meanings.definition: The state of having a physical body.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed studying the corporalities of different animals.
meanings.sent2: The doctor focused on the corporalities of his patients during the examination.
meanings.sent3: The corporalities of the teddy bear made it look very realistic.
meanings.sent4: Her dance expressed the corporalities of joy and freedom.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the corporalities of the landscape in exquisite detail.

meanings.sent1: The corporalities of the old house included its unique architecture.
meanings.sent2: His corporalities, such as his height and hair color, were inherited from his parents.
meanings.sent3: The corporalities of the cake were so appealing that everyone wanted a slice.
meanings.sent4: The corporalities of the storm were evident in the dark clouds and strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The corporalities of the flower garden attracted many butterflies.

meanings.definition: The physical aspect of a person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The corporalities of the sculpture were admired for their lifelike appearance.
meanings.sent2: She paid attention to the corporalities of the antique furniture in the room.
meanings.sent3: The corporalities of the robot made it seem almost human-like.
meanings.sent4: His speech highlighted the corporalities of determination and strength.
meanings.sent5: The corporalities of the mountain range were breathtaking from afar.
